meanings.definition: To make a speech or deliver an address.
meanings.sent1: During the school assembly, the principal speechifies about the importance of kindness.
meanings.sent2: The politician speechifies at every opportunity to share his views with the public.
meanings.sent3: The cat speechifies to the birds outside, hoping they will listen and become friends.
meanings.sent4: The sun speechifies to the flowers, encouraging them to bloom and brighten the garden.
meanings.sent5: The teacher speechifies to the students, inspiring them to work hard and achieve their goals.

meanings.definition: To speak in a formal or pompous manner.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa speechifies about the good old days when he was a young man.
meanings.sent2: The professor speechifies during lectures, using big words to impress the students.
meanings.sent3: The cat speechifies to the dog, pretending to be the ruler of the house.
meanings.sent4: The wind speechifies through the trees, rustling the leaves in a majestic way.
meanings.sent5: The king speechifies to his subjects, showing off his power and authority.
